snippet: The Food and Drug Administration on Monday approved the first drug shown to reduce the risk of H.I.V. infection, a milestone in the 30-year battle against the virus that causes AIDS.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves Truvada, a pill made by Gilead Sciences that is the first drug shown to reduce the risk of HIV infection; approval is considered a milestone in the 30-year battle against the virus that causes AIDS.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration on Monday approved the first drug shown to reduce the risk of H.I.V. infection, a milestone in the 30-year battle against the virus that causes AIDS.

headline.main: Drug Approved to Fight H.I.V. Infection
